docTitle.titlePart: The adsorption of Congo red and vacuum pump oil by rice hull ash

front.div:
Abstract
Rice hull ash (RHA) of large surface area was obtained by acid wash and then calcination at 600°C for 4 h. The white ash was
then mixed with kaolin and starch to make pellet adsorbents with reasonable strength to be utilized in a packed column. Both ash
and pellet samples showed good adsorption capacities toward the organic substances in wastewater. Furthermore, the surface nature
of the white ash and pellet adsorbent could be modi®ed through either hydration or esteri®cation reactions. Corresponding changes
in silanol concentrations were successfully correlated to changes in adsorption capacity toward either Congo red or vacuum pump
oil molecules. Ó
